main_definition: In the context of an idiom, 'shared' means something that is mutually held or experienced by two or more people.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Commonly owned or used by multiple people or groups
meanings_and_examples.example: The project was a shared endeavor between the two companies.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A resource, experience or knowledge that is shared among individuals or groups
meanings_and_examples.example: We have a shared interest in learning about different cultures.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Experienced together with others; jointly experienced
meanings_and_examples.example: Watching the movie was a deeply shared experience for our family.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Distributed or given out to be used by more than one person at a time
meanings_and_examples.example: The teacher shared his laptop with the students so they could complete their assignments.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Participated in an activity, event, or gathering together with others
meanings_and_examples.example: They enjoyed a shared meal at the local community center.
